title: stuck at Waiting for Consensus Layer when using internalcl
body:
### description of the problem

I synced `sepolia` chain from scratch on one machine and it worked just fine. Then I moved the files (rsynced) to another machine (the same operating system/cpu arch), preserved access/modification time fot the `datadir`, but the chain won't sync any further. I've performed the rsync with erigon stopped. 

Now I tried to continue the sync on the new machine, but It's stuck at `2/15 Waiting for Consensus Layer` with peers changing, but progress moving no further. The `print_stages` output differs between old and new machines but it's mystery to me how to read it so I'll count on your help.

Thanks!

#### System information

```
❯ erigon --version
erigon version 2.48.0-stable

❯ uname -a
Linux _ 6.4.2-arch1-1 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Thu, 06 Jul 2023 18:35:54 +0000 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

Concensus Layer: internal
Chain/Network: sepolia

#### start command
```
/usr/bin/erigon \
    --chain=sepolia \
    --datadir=/mnt/storage/ansible-managed/ethereum/data \
    --ethash.dagdir=/mnt/storage/ansible-managed/ethereum/data \
    --http=true \
    --healthcheck=true \
    --sentinel.addr=127.0.0.1 \
    --http.addr=127.0.0.1 \
    --http.port=8545 \
    --private.api.addr 127.0.0.1:8546 \
    --http.api=eth,erigon,engine,web3,net,txpool \
    --authrpc.addr=127.0.0.1 \
    --authrpc.jwtsecret=/mnt/storage/ansible-managed/ethereum/jwt.hex \
    --metrics=true \
    --internalcl \
    --snapshots=true \
    --torrent.download.slots=4 \
    --torrent.download.rate=128mb \
    --torrent.upload.rate=4mb \
    --verbosity info \
    --log.console.verbosity info
```

### print_stages OLD machine

I saw something similar, a couple of restarts fixed the issue by itself, I think for some reason caplin internal process is not starting sometimes, when it works you can see a ethereum 2.0 like log message.

> I saw something similar, a couple of restarts fixed the issue by itself, I think for some reason caplin internal process is not starting sometimes, when it works you can see a ethereum 2.0 like log message.

I've tried that a few times, but without luck. Is there some minimum number of peers needed for sync to start?

I guess the "fix" now is to use external CL -- I've tried prysm and it pushed through
so we have a bunch of pre used checkpoint sync URLs, I had problems with them on Sepolia. will take a look
ah, just for the record, I've seen it on mainnet
some things to add, i think the solution is better logging, the CL is doing something but if checkpoint is too far, it may go silent for a long time.

Update
Not stuck, just no progress during PoS header downloading.
See Giulio's comment https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/7923#issuecomment-1650859429

Me too, encountering the similar problem on the sepolia testnet.

In the past 7 hours, the number of p2p peers keeps changing, no further progress.
The eth.blockNumber did not change, `eth.blockNumber == 3997098`, and `eth.syncing == false`
Also happend after
```log
[2/15 Headers] Waiting for Consensus Layer...
```

Here is the command line arguments passed to erigon, I have also tried using `--internalcl=true`, no difference.
```bash
erigon \
    --internalcl \
    --chain=sepolia \
    --prune=hrtc \
    --http.addr=0.0.0.0 \
    --snapshots=true \
    --verbosity=5
```

Some history logs below which might help:

Tried the devel branch, and core dumped.
Maybe the following logs could help locating the problem.

> some things to add, i think the solution is better logging, the CL is doing something but if checkpoint is too far, it may go silent for a long time.

You are right, the CL was working.
I left the erigon (stable branch) running, and now it is OK, the sync is now pushing forward.
The log shows that downloading the PoS header took 6 hours and 34 minutes.
